thread.title: Militia secures home-field advantage in upcoming NEFL playoffs
thread.title_full: Militia secures home-field advantage in upcoming NEFL playoffs

author: Richard Gregory
title: Militia secures home-field advantage in upcoming NEFL playoffs
text:
Militia secures home-field advantage in upcoming NEFL playoffs By Richard Gregory Published 1:41 pm, Thursday, October 1, 2015 Photo: H John Voorhees III / H John Voorhees III Image 1 of / 5 Close Image 1 of 5 
FILE PHOTO: The Militia's Lionel Assie (22) cuts off a block by team mate Jason Davis (5) on Panthers Courtney Sutherland (2) during the New England Football League AAA semifinals between the Western Connecticut Militia and the Connecticut Panthers, on Sunday, November 2, 2014, at Waterbury Municipal Stadium, Waterbury, Conn. Photo: H John Voorhees III / H John Voorhees III FILE PHOTO: The Militia's Lionel Assie (22) cuts off a block by... Image 2 of 5 
FILE PHOTO: Western Connecticut Militia runner Ryan Mack breaks a tackle attempt by Tyree Craig of the New Jersey Spartans in a game at Immaculate High School. Sunday, Aug. 5, 2012 Photo: Scott Mullin / Scott Mullin FILE PHOTO: Western Connecticut Militia runner Ryan Mack breaks a... Image 3 of 5 
FILE PHOTO: Western Connecticut Militia's Matt Tyrell (8) leaps to catch a pass in front of New Haven's Taquarry Fitzgerald (4) during a New England Football League pre-season game between the New Haven Venom and the Western Connecticut Militia at Rogers Park, in Danbury, Conn, on Saturday, June 13, 2015. Photo: H John Voorhees III / Hearst Connecticut Media FILE PHOTO: Western Connecticut Militia's Matt Tyrell (8) leaps to... Image 4 of 5 
FILE PHOTO: Western Connecticut Militia's quarterback Kevin Oberg tries to break free from a takle in a game against the Tri-State Bulldogs, played at Danbury High School. Saturday, July 27, 2013 Photo: Scott Mullin / Scott Mullin FILE PHOTO: Western Connecticut Militia's quarterback Kevin Oberg... Image 5 of 5 
FILE PHOTO: Western Connecticut Militia's quarter back Kevin Oberg (11) hands the ball of to running back Moquan Dicken (21) during a New England Football League pre-season game between the New Haven Venom and the Western Connecticut Militia at Rogers Park, in Danbury, Conn, on Saturday, June 13, 2015. Photo: H John Voorhees III / Hearst Connecticut Media FILE PHOTO: Western Connecticut Militia's quarter back Kevin Oberg... Militia secures home-field advantage in upcoming NEFL playoffs 1 / 5 Back to Gallery 
After three months and 10 regular-season games failed to determine a champion in the New England Football League ’s Colonial Conference Southern Division, a coin-toss was used to determine which team — the Western Connecticut Militia of Danbury or the Connecticut Panthers of Meriden, who finished with identical 9-1 records and split their two regular-season meetings — would earn the top seed and home-field advantage in the upcoming playoffs. 
The Militia won the toss, and with it a bye in this weekend’s wild-card playoff round. The Militia will host either the Hartford Colts or the Pioneer Valley Knights in the divisional playoff round next weekend at a time and site to be determined. 
The Militia secured a share of the division lead with a 42-12 victory over Pioneer Valley on Saturday. Quarterback Kevin Oberg completed touchdown passes to Kreston Harrison , Ryan Mack and Matt Tyrell . Aaron Taylor rushed for two touchdowns and Lionel Assie rushed for one. Tyler Kurjiaka added a 41-yard field goal.
